name: SnykTask
description: Run Snyk to scan your dependencies for vulnerabilities.
author: Jesse Houwing

inputs.helpMarkdown: Path to the folder containing your `package.json`. Optionally append `/*` to scan all projects directly under the selected folder.
inputs.label: Project folder
inputs.name: optionProjectsToScan
actionProtect
inputs.label: Protect
inputs.helpMarkDown: Protect your code from vulnerabilities and optionally suppress specific vulnerabilities.

inputs.name: actionMonitor
inputs.label: Monitor
inputs.helpMarkDown: Record the state of dependencies and any vulnerabilities on snyk.io.

inputs.name: optionMonitorBranches
inputs.label: Only monitor for these branches
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Only call monitor when on the supplied branches or when no filter is entered. Seperate options by `;` or each on a newline. Supports wildcards. Will match against `$(Build.SourceBranch)`.
e.g. `/heads/refs/master;/heads/refs/hotfix/*

inputs.name: optionAuthenticationType
inputs.label: Authentication Type
inputs.helpMarkdown: Select how to authenticate to snyk.io. For better security use a service endpoint. A authentication token is required in order to run **Protect** and **Monitor**.

inputs.name: optServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Auth (API Token)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select or configure the service endpoint to provide your snyk.io API token.

Go to [snyk.io/Account](https://snyk.io/account/) to find your API Token.

inputs.helpMarkdown:
Provide an API token directly, for security consider using a service endpoint, but at least store the value in a variable that is marked secret.

Go to [snyk.io/Account](https://snyk.io/account/) to find your API Token.
inputs.label: Auth (API Token)
inputs.name: optAuth
optionFailBuild
inputs.label: Fail Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, will fail the build if snyk detects vulnerable packages; otherwise it will only log a warning.

inputs.name: optionTrustPolicies
inputs.label: Trust policies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Applies and uses ignore rules from your dependencies's Snyk policies, otherwise ignore policies are only shown as a suggestion. (`--trust-policies`)

inputs.helpMarkdown: Associate a snapshot (or wizard snapshot) with a specific organisation. (`--org=<org>`).
inputs.label: Organization
inputs.name: optionOrg

inputs.helpMarkdown: Supply any additional parameters to the call to snyk.
inputs.label: Additional arguments
inputs.name: optAdditionalArguments
optionSnykInstallation
inputs.label: Snyk location
inputs.helpMarkdown: Select which snyk executable to call.
Upgrade the snyk version that's packaged wih this task.
inputs.label: Upgrade Snyk
inputs.name: optionUpgrade

inputs.helpMarkdown: Full path to where snyk is located (for when snyk is not part of the path). (e.g.: `$(Build.SourcesDirectory)\node_modules\.bin\snyk.cmd`).
inputs.label: Path to Snyk
inputs.name: pathToSnyk
